choices.answer: individual rights.
republicanism.
popular sovereignty.
separation of powers.

questions.question: How does the Constitution reflect the principle of federalism?

choices.answer: by establish a strong executive branch
by implementing a system of checks and balances
by dividing power between federal and state governments

questions.question: The term “judicial review” means that the Supreme Court has the ability to determine if ____

choices.answer: by establishing a strong legislative branch
by dividing power between federal and state governments
by implementing a system of checks and balances
a law passed by Congress is unconstitutional.

questions.question: What does the principle of separation of powers make possible in American government?

choices.answer: It provides a system of checks and balances among branches of government
It maintains the sovereignty of the executive branch.
It expands the power of the central gov. and limits the power of state gov.
It enables citizens to choose their representatives by popular vote.

choices.answer: it provides all Americans with an opportunity to fulfill thier civic duty

Serving on a jury protects the rights of someone accused of a crime.

choices.answer: Both had three branches of government
